item.title: Week 19 & 20 Google Summer of Code @ LLVM
item.description: These couple of weeks have been very hectic as my college has started and campus placements have started as well so I have been busy with that as well. Progress Added submenu for navbar which is configurable. Created table of contents component. Created /gsoc-projects page using yaml data file. Created a custom shortcode for creating new pages using data files. Wrote stylesheet for standard markdown pages. Wrote some documentation for creating new pages in the website using datamap.

item.title: Week 18 Google Summer of Code @ LLVM
item.description: This week I set up a website in a new repository using the theme developed. I fixed some UI bugs and made the hero section links configurable. I also wrote documentation for the theme and set up a workflow for deploying using GitHub Pages. The website is live at https://chaitanyashahare.com/testing-llvm-www-template for now. We are in the process of hosting it on the llvm.org test sub-domain.

item.title: Week 17 Google Summer of Code @ LLVM
item.description: This week I deployed a website created using the theme developed, on GitHub pages. The website’s home page at my domain for testing here https://chaitanyashahare.com/testing-llvm-www-template. Working on making the footer configurable as it’ll vary a lot across websites. The footer will be configurable from the hugo.yml configuration file.

item.title: Week 15 Google Summer of Code @ LLVM
item.description: This week I completed the theme switcher and made the website responsive. I am now working on adding a navbar menu to the website. item.title: I Got Accepted in Google Summer of Code (GSoC) 2024!!!
item.description: I am very delighted to announce that I have been accepted into Google Summer of Code 2024! It’s an incredible opportunity, and I’m beyond excited to be a part of this enriching experience. For those who may not be familiar, Google Summer of Code (GSoC) is a global program that connects students with open source software organizations to work on a summer programming project under the guidance of experienced mentors.
